description: shaped like a chrysanthemum; has box and a black felt stand with U-shaped metal mount; box: L1.1 MS, 7/5/02 kk
text: Made from gold in the shape of a chrysanthemum flower, this small bowl or cup reflects the taste for plant forms which is often encountered in Sung dynasty metalwork, lacquer, and ceramics. Perhaps made as part of a set of utensils, it is possible that this cup originally had an accompanying stand or saucer made of gold and decorated with similar motifs.
title: Flower-Form Bowl
